description: In Al Hudaydah, over 40 % people believe that water can not transmit diseases
people pay for water mainly in Lahj and Al Hudaydah

description: Those who received drip irrigation have significantly higher MAHFP scores

description: Land cultivators and formal employer have the lowest FCS Scores which is surprising since formal employer have globally the highest income per member. Howaver, as we can see below this might be because most of them are also unemployed as they say they have no source of Livelihood.
They also have the lowest level of income per family member
title: Income per family member split by income source

description: Those living from livestock have higher level of debt
title: Level of debt per main source of income

description: Those having received husbandry training are more likely to do some sickness prevention for their livestock.
xtitle: What steps do you take to prevent your livestock from getting sick?
title: Prevention of livestock sickness according to participation to husbandry training

description: In Al Hudaydah people seems to mainly purchase fodder for cattles

title: FCS Score according to beneficiary type

description: Those with no source of livelihood are particularly vulnerable

description: The way to treat diarrhea can vary very much from one region to another, for instance, in Taiz and Marib people quite often  use traditional medicine while almost never in Lahj and Al udaydah
Debts for weddings seem to be quite important
title: Level and purpose of debt

description: The more people have been displaced the more likely they have higher CSI index

description: Surprisingly it seems that those purchasing fodder have  higher CSI index. This is probably because they do not have other choice (availability of land to pasture maybe)
